author: Lizzie Porter
title: Wizz Air cabin baggage restrictions
text: How many pieces of luggage can I bring in the cabin with me? One. Size : 42 x 32 x 25cm - it must fit under the seat in front. For a fee, customers may opt to bring a piece of luggage measuring up to 56 x 45 x 25cm. Weight : No limit Can I book a hold bag on a single leg, and travel hand-luggage only on the other? Yes. Related Articles Flybe hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Jet2 cabin luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Monarch cabin luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Thomson hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Am I allowed any items in addition to my one cabin bag ? Passengers may bring on board duty-free items bought post security screening at the airport. They may also carry a coat or blanket, a mobile phone, cellular phone, reading material for the flight. Anything else? Passengers travelling with children under the age of two may bring food for the duration of the flight, and a foldable baby carriage or a small crib. Passengers with disabilities may bring a pair of crutches. See WizzAir's guidance on cabin luggage allowances .
